S3Ranger Delete Modal

The delete modal allows users to permanently delete files or folders from S3. This action cannot be undone.

Modal Design

Delete File
This action cannot be undone
s3://my-bucket/documents/important-file.pdf
This file will be permanently deleted from S3
Tab Navigate Ctrl+Enter Delete
Esc Cancel

For Folders

Delete Folder
This action cannot be undone
s3://my-bucket/documents/reports/
This folder and all its contents will be permanently deleted from S3
Tab Navigate Ctrl+Enter Delete
Esc Cancel

Features

  • Confirmation Required: Shows clear warning that the action cannot be undone
  • File/Folder Support: Can delete individual files or entire directories
  • S3 Path Display: Shows the exact S3 path that will be deleted
  • Red Delete Button: Visually distinct red styling to indicate destructive action
  • Keyboard Shortcuts: Ctrl+Enter to delete, Esc to cancel
  • Loading State: Shows loading indicator during deletion
  • Error Handling: Displays helpful error messages if deletion fails

Usage

To use the delete modal in your code:

from s3ranger.ui.modals import DeleteModal

# For deleting a file
def delete_file(self, s3_path: str):
    modal = DeleteModal(s3_path=s3_path, is_folder=False)
    self.app.push_screen(modal, callback=self.on_delete_complete)

# For deleting a folder
def delete_folder(self, s3_path: str):
    modal = DeleteModal(s3_path=s3_path, is_folder=True)
    self.app.push_screen(modal, callback=self.on_delete_complete)

def on_delete_complete(self, success: bool):
    if success:
        # Refresh the file listing
        self.refresh_objects()
